dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla sits up in bed. She looks around. She looks at the clock: 11:24. She rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla opens the drapes at the front window and looks out. All is dark and quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus and Jenny are seated in a booth. They are drinking soft drinks. A waitress approaches and delivers their foo salads and ten-dollar hamburgers.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Thanks. Marcus pulls a folded up piece of paper from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Just listen to this... (reading) "September 13...I don't know anybody else my age who hasn't slept with someone. Not anybody. Sometimes I think there might be something wrong with me. But I know that's the devil, tempting me."

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Oh. Religious girl.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: "I want to. Sometimes I want to so bad I can hardly stand it. I want to make love with Daniel--" That's a guy she went out with a couple of times. "But I know it isn't right. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know he's not the right one. I don't want to be a nun, but I won't make love with any man who I wouldn't want to be the father of my children."

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Good luck with that.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: "I know I'll find him. I know I will."

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Amazing.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: She's dead.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Jen--

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: No, listen to me. Alright, she was an amazing woman. But she's dead. She's cold and she's in the ground and she's never coming back. Have you ever known anybody who's come back from the dead? Because, you know, I haven't.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: (a moment, then...) I must be losing my mind.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Well, you are starting to remind me of Martineau.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Martineau's completely insane. I am not completely insane. It's just-- I finally fall in love, I mean really fall in love...and it's with a dead girl.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: A crazy wife and a dead girlfriend. This is just me talking, but...I think maybe you should raise your standards a little.  57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla wears a white robe. She sits on the edge of the tub and turns on the faucet. She looks out, through the doorway, into the kitchen. A small television on the counter plays DRACULA: PRINCE OF DARKNESS starring Christopher Lee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie sits on the edge of the bed. Caroline kneels in fro of her. Josie slides off her shoes. Caroline reaches betw Josie's thighs, and unsnaps her stockings. Caroline peels off Josie's stocking.

dialogues.speaker: JOSIE
dialogues.text: That's it, baby. Show me. You show me how it's done.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Don't talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla slides into the tub. She has moved the television t the tiled ledge near the faucet. DRACULA still plays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caroline kneels behind Josie on the bed. They are facing dressing table with a large round mirror. Caroline unties Josie's blouse and pulls it over her head Josie closes her eyes, and tilts her head, exposing her n Caroline picks up one of the discarded stockings. She wra each end around her fists. She gently lowers the stocking over Josie's head. Josie feels the stocking on her neck. She smiles. She ope her eyes. Caroline smiles at her in the mirror. Josie see that she has wrapped each end of the stocking tightly aro her fists.

dialogues.speaker: JOSIE
dialogues.text: What--? Caroline tightens. Josie reacts quickly. She gets three fingers between the stocking and her neck as Caroline tightens.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: I've come back for you, Josie.  58. Josie fights. She thrashes, but can't get loose. She rise Caroline wraps her legs around Josie, and holds on for th ride. Josie spins and throws herself back, against the mirror. smashes. Caroline lets go, and falls. Josie staggers towa the door as she pulls the stocking from her neck and gasp for breath.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You trying to kill me again? Josie turns for the door.

dialogues.speaker: JOSIE
dialogues.text: (her voice is hoarse) Ray! She starts down the hallway. Caroline rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray plays with the buttons on Petra's blouse. He hears Jo scream. He jumps up. Petra falls onto the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie rushes for the door.

dialogues.speaker: JOSIE
dialogues.text: Ray!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray gets to the apartment door. He tries the knob. The door is locked.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Josie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie runs for the door. Caroline enters the hallway, fro the bedroom. She pursues, but she doesn't follow the natu rules of the universe as we know them. She runs up the side of the wall. She scurries along the ceiling, and then hangs upside down, her face between Jos and the door. Her face turns into the demon. Josie screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray steps back and kicks the door open. Caroline drops fr the ceiling and spins. Crouching, she hisses.  59.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Did you miss me, Ray? Ray staggers back, terrified. Caroline charges. She pushes him back, over the railing. He falls three flo through the empty space between the stairs. He lands with sickening crack and a thud. Blood immediately pools aroun his head. Caroline turns to Petra. Josie runs deeper into her apartment. She locks herself in the bathroom. Caroline grabs Petra by the throat and slams her against wall. She seems undecided on whether to kill the girl. Sh notices an emergency fire hose attached to the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caroline has tied the fire hose around Petra's neck. She forces the girl toward the stair rail. Petra struggles. Caroline throws her over the rail. Below, an OLD WOMAN opens her apartment door and steps ou as the hose reaches it's maximum length. Petra's neck sna Her body swings and her face spins toward the old woman. The old woman screams. Caroline goes back into Josie's apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie freaks out in the bathroom. The only lock is a tiny old-fashioned slide lock under the knob. She pushes back the sliding glass door on the shower, but the shower window is way too small. She would never get through it. She's trapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caroline tries the knob on the bathroom door. She jiggles it. She pushes on the door.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: I thought we were friends, Josie. But then you killed me. It's not nice...to kill your friends. Caroline looks through the keyhole.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Josie, sweetie. Now you're just being rude. Don't you like me?  60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie searches the medicine cabinet for something, anythi She finds a metal nail file. Too flimsy, too small. She finds a can of hair spray. She looks down at an unused candle near the sink, and a c cigarette lighter next to it. She tears the top off the hair spray. She grabs the light She flicks it. It doesn't light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caroline pulls on the door, hard.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: I want you to apologize. She kicks at the door. It almost opens, but doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're going to apologize. If it's the last thing you do. She kicks it hard. The door flies open. Caroline puts on her demon face as Josie sprays the hair spray and flicks lighter. This time...it works. The lighter ignites the hair spray. A blast of fire engul Caroline's face. She screams. Her face burns, but she doesn't back away. She hangs her head, her hands on her face. Her screams become moans, her moans become...laught She looks up at Josie. One of her eyelids has burned away Her face has already begun to blister. She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stupid bitch! You can't KILL ME! She reaches out for Josie. Josie fights. She isn't ready to give up. She scratches at Caroline's face. Caroline howls and throws her against the sink and medicine cabine The glass breaks, cutting Josie's back. In excruciating pain, Josie lifts her legs. She gets her feet on Caroline's chest. She kicks, hard, with her legs. Caroline flies back and crashes through the glass shower door. She falls into the tub. She doesn't get up. Her legs hang over the edge. They jerk once, then again. Josie approaches. She looks into the tub. Caroline lies on her back. A huge shard of glass has slic into her neck. Blood pours, pulsates, from her neck. Her eyes are blank. Her body, dying, quivers.  61. Josie backs away from the tub. Behind her, in the medicin cabinet, most of the broken mirror is still intact. She turns toward the cabinet, and sees the demon face in the shattered mirror. She screams and spins around. There is no one there. She backs into the hallway, slides down into a sitting position against the wall, and sobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla soaks in a tub full of bubbles. She watches the sma television. She hears a car. She reaches for her robe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny stops the car in Marcus's driveway. They both look the house. He doesn't get out.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: You sure you want to go in there? We could go back to my place for a while.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: And then what? Jenny gives a small shrug. He knows what she's suggesting

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jen...you're my best friend...

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Sometimes that works out. She puts a hand on his thigh. He doesn't move away.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I think the odds would be against us. She moves toward him.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: The odds are always against us. We always beat the odds.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Always?

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Almost always. She kisses him. He kisses her back.  62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla is at the window, in her robe. She sees Marcus kiss Jenny. She turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus pulls away, slowly. Jenny opens her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I gotta go. He gets out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Marcus...

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: That was a good kiss.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: World class. He closes the door. He starts toward the house. Jenny watches him go, then pulls out of the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus enters the house. It is dark, except for the light in the bathroom and bedroom. He goes toward the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Carla. She doesn't answer. He looks into the bathroom. She's bac in the tub.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey. You're out of bed. That's good. She looks at him, but doesn't speak.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm gonna get out of my uniform. She doesn't respond. He goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus takes off his shirt. He puts on an undershirt.  63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla watches the television. She picks up the belt from her robe. She flicks it at the television. The belt falls into the water. She tries it again. This time, filled with water, it slap the television. She leans forward. She wraps the belt aro the television. She leans back. She holds one end of the belt in each han It is wrapped around the back of the television. She pull on it. The television inches forward, toward the edge. She watches, her face emotionless. She pulls on it again. The edge of the television slides to the edge of the bath She stares at the television. Marcus enters. He sees the television, the belt, Carla.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Carla? She turns to him, without expression.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Babe? She pulls on the belt with both hands. The television tip then falls into the water.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No! The television explodes on impact. Carla jerks and shiver and thrashes in the water. The lights in the house flicke and then fail. Marcus yanks the cord out of the wall. He pulls Carla fro the tub and lays her on the floor. She is unconscious. He checks her pulse. Nothing. He tilts her head back and breathes into her mouth. He pushes on her chest. He grabs his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shawn, she's done it! Carla's done it. I need you at the house. Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shawn walks briskly toward the ambulance. Jackson, the ba EMT, is already in the driver's seat.  64.

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: (into cell phone) Hold on, man! We're on our way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shawn and Jackson arrive with a kit and a portable defibrillator.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Give me the bag! Jackson hands it over.

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: She breathing?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: Any pulse?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: No. Shawn turns on the defibrillator.

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: How long?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Four minutes. A little more. (positions the patches) Clear. Shawn hits her with the electricity. She settles. Shawn checks the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: Nothing. Marcus takes the defibrillator.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Clear! He hits her again. She settles. He checks her pulse.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nothing. Damn it!

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: One more time.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: C'mon, Carla. Get back here.  65. He hits her. He checks her pulse. He breathes into her mouth. He pushes on her chest. This woman is not coming back.

dialogues.speaker: COME ON
dialogues.text: Marcus takes the defibrillator.

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: It's done, man. She's gone. Marcus hits her again. Her body arches, settles, then mov She coughs.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Get her in the ambulance. Now!

dialogues.speaker: JACKSON
dialogues.text: Holy shit. Dazed, Carla looks at Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: We've got you. You're gonna be alright. Carla looks at Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Marcus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ambulance races toward the hospital. Jackson drives like a bat out of hell. Shawn is in the back with Marcus and Carla. Carla has an oxygen mask on. Marcus finishes putting in a I.V. She tries to take off her mask.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: No, baby. You need to keep that on. She tries anyway. He helps her take it off.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What is it? You want to say something.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Marcus...

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Yeah. What is it, babe? She lightly squeezes his hand.  66.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: I...love you. She is looking at him with an expression we've never seen her face. There is something so beautifully peaceful in h expression. Shawn looks away. Marcus, confused, stares at Carla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus and Shawn lead Carla's gurney toward the O.R. They are met by the E.R. CREW, Dr. Rollins included. Marcus holds Carla's hand.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLINS
dialogues.text: This the suicide?

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: T.V. in the bathtub.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: She was gone. We brought her back.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLINS
dialogues.text: You are one lucky lady. (to Marcus) We got her.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I'm going with her.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLINS
dialogues.text: Not after last time. Shawn takes his arm.

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: Don't...It's his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rollins and a nurse work on Carla. They check her blood pressure. They examine the burns on her chest. Marcus sits in a chair nearby. He stares at the floor in disbelief. He looks up at Carla. She looks at him, with calm affection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carruthers is at the bar, drinking a Guinness, when his c phone rings. He answers.

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: Yeah.  67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, the cop, paces in Josie's hallway. INTERCUT WITH INT. BAR.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It's Frank. We found the school teacher. What's left of her.

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: A crackhouse on Second South.

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: 700 block.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Yeah. How'd you know?

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: I'll be right over. Carruthers slaps some money on the bar, and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus sits on the edge of Carla's bed. He holds her hand She looks at him lovingly.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Your wife...she's dead. You understand that, don't you? He nods. She pulls him into an embrace.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's alright.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Emma...

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: It's alright. We're together now. Everything will be alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carruthers enters. Frank is waiting to meet him. They pas Ray's uncovered body on their way up the stairs. A CORONE pokes at the body.  68.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Let him through. He's with me. (to Carruthers) There's the first one. Carruthers looks down at Ray's broken head as he climbs t stairs. They pass Petra's hanging body. A police PHOTOGRAPHER snaps photos of the corpse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carruthers looks through the bathroom doorway. He sees Caroline's corpse in the tub. He turns back to Frank in t hallway.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: And that right there is the end of the story. We don't know why she went on the rampage, but...she ain't walking out the door this time. Carruthers hears Josie's voice. He looks into her room. She's on the bed, talking to a COP. A PARAMEDIC is trying to sedate her.

dialogues.speaker: JOSIE
dialogues.text: That wasn't no schoolteacher! It was her! It was Lizzie! I could see it in her eyes. In her...voice. The things she said. It was her. I know it was her!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (to Carruthers) She claims the woman climbed on the walls, like a spider. Freaky stuff. We're gonna get her to take a blood test. Gotta see what's floating around in there. Carruthers looks back to Caroline's body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus sits on Carla's bed. They are sharing Carla's hosp breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: It was so strange. It was like I fell asleep, in the ambulance, looking at you. I didn't want to go, but I was so tired...and then when I woke up, there you were again. You were the first thing I saw.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Do you remember anything in between?  69.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: You mean like a tunnel or heaven or anything? No. It's like I was dreaming. I just remember this feeling, wanting to come back. Lathrop, the administrator, knocks on the door.

dialogues.speaker: LATHROP
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Mr. Galan. There are some papers for you to sign at the nurse's station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus is at the nurse's station with Lathrop and Rollins

dialogues.speaker: ROLLINS
dialogues.text: We've got to institutionalize her. There's no other option.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Look, I've told you. She wasn't trying to kill herself. It was an accident. I was there. I saw what happened...It was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: LATHROP
dialogues.text: You're taking an awful chance with her life. Do you realize that?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I know that...You've talked to her. Does she seem suicidal to you?... It was a freak accident. That's all it was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus enters Carla's room. He stands at the door and loo at her. She is watching a cartoon on television. She smil and laughs with childlike delight. She gently bites her lower lip. She looks at Marcus. He smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Is everything alright?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Everything's good. He goes to the bed.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Are they going to let me go home?  70.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: In just a few days. They want you to rest and heal a little bit.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: I'm going home with you. I'm your wife. That's so strange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus walks Carla down the hall. She wears her gown, and slippers. She rests her head against his shoulder. They pass the chapel.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Oh! Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: It's a little chapel. He stops and looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want you to do something for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus looks at a display of children's rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus and Carla are kneeling at the little altar at the front of the chapel. He slips a ring onto her finger. It is a three-dollar plastic ring.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: With this ring I thee wed. Carla is delighted. She takes another other ring, which i slightly less feminine, and puts it on his finger.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: And I promise to love you, cherish you...what else?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: In sickness and in health.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Right. As long as we both shall live.  71.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I now pronounce us man and wife.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: You may kiss the bride. He leans forward. They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carruthers searches for a book. From the titles on the sp it clear that he is in the "Occult" section. Later, he is at a long table with several books spread ou and opened. He turns a page and studies a medieval drawin of an evil female winged demon as she attacks an infant i its mother's arms. One of the other books is open to an illustration of a pentagram. Carruthers leans back, sighs, rubs his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus opens the car door. He leads Carla to the house. She carries some flowers and a balloon from the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: This is our house?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I know. It's not much.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: No. It's nice. He unlocks the front door. She starts to go in.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Wait. He picks her up, and carries her across the threshold. Sh is delighted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus lays Carla down on the bed. He kisses her. They start to make love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carruthers looks up from his books. He notices a man at t far end of the table. The man is bearded, with small roun eye glasses and rumpled clothes. It is the man we saw ear walking his dogs in Lindsay's neighborhood. It is Martine Martineau works with stacks of books open around him. He looks over at Carruthers. Carruthers gives him a small sm  72. Martineau, expressionless, goes back to his books. Carruthers turns the page in his book. He sees another drawing, similar to the first. This time, the demon is ea a man's intestines. The man is still alive and screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus is very gently, very slowly, almost making love to Carla. She touches his face.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Marcus... He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's my soul that's a virgin. Not my body. You don't have to be so gentle. He resumes his task, less cautiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla stands at the mirror, in her robe. She looks at her face in the mirror. She studies it. She looks at her teet she touches a small scar on her chin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus lies on the bed, asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla steps back from the mirror. She removes the robe. She looks at her naked body in the mirror. Her expression says: "Not bad at all."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carruthers enters a police observation room. Frank, cup o coffee in hand, stands near the window. Josie is on the other side of the glass.

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: Thanks for letting me in.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Toxicology came back. She must be the only hooker in the city who isn't on something.

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: You mind if I talk to her?  73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carruthers sits across the table from Josie.

dialogues.speaker: JOSIE
dialogues.text: I thought you said you wasn't a cop.

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: I'm not. Used to be.

dialogues.speaker: JOSIE
dialogues.text: They don't believe me. They think I'm crazy.

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: I believe every word you said.

dialogues.speaker: JOSIE
dialogues.text: You do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus drives through a residential neighborhood. Carla i in the passenger seat. She is wearing a colorful scarf as blindfold.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Where are you taking me?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: You'll see.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: So mysterious...

dialogues.speaker: JOSIE
dialogues.text: She was sick, you know. She got the H.I.V. Carruthers nods.

dialogues.speaker: JOSIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Me and the other girls, we always make the men wear condoms. Always. Not Lizzie. And if her men tried to put one on, she'd get 'em excited, then she'd take it off. She wanted to make 'em sick. She didn't just want their money...She wanted to destroy them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus stops the car outside Emma's house. Emma's mother, Charlotte, is weeding the flower garden at the front step  74.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Are we here?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: We're here. He reaches over and helps her take off the blindfold. She looks around. Her smile slowly fades.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your mom's working on the flowers. Carla looks at the woman. Her expression is not soft. Mar opens his door.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Marcus--

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Come on. Let's go see her. She grabs his arm.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's alright. I can introduce you as my wife. We can be friends with her. You can still know her.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: This is so sweet. I know what you're trying to do. But...this is my old life. I have to be somebody else now. I don't want to think about the past. I want everything to be new for us. I want to celebrate. Our future. Marcus looks out at Camille. He thinks it over.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: You want to celebrate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus and Carla eat at a very fancy restaurant. They're eating steaks and drinking red wine. Marcus hands her a nicely wrapped gift.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Open it. She does. It is a leather-bound blank diary.  75.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A new book for a new start. I know how much you like to write. She closes it.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you like it?

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: I'm not going to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: You're not.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: I'm going to show you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla throws Marcus down on the bed. She climbs on top of him. He rolls her over and kisses her. She rolls him onto his back.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: I like it better this way. She rips his shirt open. He likes it. She kisses his ches She licks his nipple, then playfully bites it.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Ow. She laughs. She kisses his belly and unbuckles his pants. She gently bites her lower lip. She takes the skin above his belly button into her mouth. He's in heaven. Then she bites him.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ouch. That hurt.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Sorry. She pulls his pants down. He's a little worried now, but lets her do her thing. And then she bites him again.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Ow! Dammit! That hurts. He pulls back to the head of the bed. She stays where she is, on all fours. He looks down at his stomach. She's dra blood. She looks up at him, a wicked smile on her face, a animal look in her eyes.  76.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: (in a deep, guttaral, dual voice) Sucram em cuph. It's as if she slapped him in the face. She crawls to him kisses him. He doesn't kiss back. She looks down at his lap.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What happened? You don't like me? She starts to go down again. He slides out of the bed. He buckles his pants.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You gonna make me finish on my own? He looks at her, takes his shirt, leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus sits at the kitchen table. He drinks a cup of coff Carla enters. She stands in the doorway. She leans agains the wall and watches him.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. He doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I just...I thought...that's what you'd want me to do.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What was that? What you said.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: I don't know. She goes to him, puts her arms around him. He tenses.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let's start over. I'll be me this time. She kisses him. Slowly, reluctantly, he starts to respond

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carruthers and Frank sit at the bar, both nursing a Guinn

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna investigate this, you know that. As far as the department is concerned, this case is closed.  77.

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You're gonna keep going, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (sighs, puts his money on the counter) Just...I don't know. Be careful.

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: Yes, dear. Frank goes. Carruthers takes another drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus is asleep. Carla brings him breakfast in bed. She wakes him.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Wake up, sleepy head. I didn't wear you out last night, did I?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: You have to be to work in 45 minutes. So eat your eggs and toast.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What are you going to do today?

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Don't know. Shopping, probably. As she leaves the room, she flips up the back of her robe and flashes her ass at him. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll start the shower. (stops in doorway) I'll be waiting for you. She goes. He looks down at the food, but doesn't eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla exits the house. She locks the front door. She walk to her car, gets in, starts the car, and drives away.  78. Marcus watches her from his car, which he has parked on t side of the street a half a block away. He follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla's car passes the homeless shelter without even slow down. Marcus follows, several cars behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus pulls his car to the curb near the crackhouse. He watches as Carla walks up the front steps and enters. He' very confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carruthers knocks on Marcus's door. There is no answer. H peeks in the window. No one's home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus watches from his car as Carla exits the crackhouse At the sidewalk she stops to talk to a TATTOOED MAN. The man clearly doesn't know her. He is reluctant at firs but she shows him some money, and he instantly warms to h He looks around, as if expecting to see someone watching him, then leads Carla into the building. Marcus watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carruthers goes to the front desk of the ambulance statio A RECEPTIONIST hangs up the telephone and looks up at him

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: I'm looking for Marcus Galan.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. He's not in today.

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: Do you have his cell phone number?

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: I can't give that out. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: Let me give you my card. Have him call me the minute he gets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus is still waiting outside the crackhouse. Finally, Carla emerges from the building. She carries an envelope, which she folds and puts into her bag.  79. She goes to her car, and starts away. Marcus pulls out to follow and collides into a passing car.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Dammit! His fender is smashed. The other DRIVER gets out. Marcus watches Carla's car disappear around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carruthers cruises the downtown streets, looking for Josi He sees her. She walks the street, cautiously looking for business. Carruthers pulls his car to the curb.

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: Hey, sister.

dialogues.speaker: JOSIE
dialogues.text: I don't want to talk about that anymore.

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: This isn't about that.

dialogues.speaker: JOSIE
dialogues.text: What's it about?

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: How much do I get for fifty dollars?

dialogues.speaker: JOSIE
dialogues.text: Everybody gets relief, baby.

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: How much do I get for five hundred?

dialogues.speaker: JOSIE
dialogues.text: Five hundred... He nods. He shows her the cash. She moves to the car.

dialogues.speaker: JOSIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Alright, old man. For five hundred dollars I'm gonna give you the party mix, baby. We watch, from someone's p.o.v., as Josie gets in the car Carruthers drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus enters.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Emma?  80. She's not there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus eats dinner alone at the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla approaches the DOORMAN at a busy night club. She gi him the envelope. He opens it, gives it back, and lets he in. The others, who are still waiting in line, watch her enviously as she enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla enters the night club. A goth band is screaming and rocking on the stage. Hundreds of PARTIERS are banging th heads and bodies to the music. A young ROCKER, beer in hand, pushes his GIRLFRIEND again the wall.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKER
dialogues.text: You spilled my fucking beer!

dialogues.speaker: GIRLFRIEND
dialogues.text: You were falling down. I was just-- He slaps her. Carla passes by. She doesn't give the Rocke and the girl a second glance. After she passes, the Rocke once again pushes the girl against the wall. Carla approaches a table where a MAN WITH A GOATEE entert his friends. She gives the Goatee the letter. He reads it He stands and leads Carla into a corridor. The goth band continues to play. The Goatee emerges from office. Carla gives him a wad of money. The Goatee gives her a small paper bag. She smiles and starts away. On her way to the door, Carla sees the Rocker sitting at table, surrounded by FRIENDS. His beer is full again, and he looks like he's had one too many. Carla stops at his table. The Rocker looks at her. So do his friends. She unbuttons the top button of her blouse a playfully bites her lower lip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla enters the men's bathroom with the Rocker and three his friends. A MAN leaves as they enter. One of the Rocke friends, we'll just call him #2, puts his back against th door. #3 has a video camera to record the beautiful momen  81.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKER
dialogues.text: Alright. Let's see what you're advertising. He pushes Carla against the sink, bends her over, lifts h skirt.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: You like that?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKER
dialogues.text: That's...that's alright. The Rocker laughs. He and his friends look like kids in a candy store. The Rocker starts to unbuckle his belt. #3 lifts the video camera and starts to record. He starts at Carla's waist and then moves to her face. She turns to hi and looks into the camera. Her smile becomes a snarl. She turns into the demon. #3 drops the camera. Carla pulls a knife from her belt. W recognize it as the silver-handled ceremonial knife with serpentine blade. She puts the knife to use.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNG CLUBBER approaches the men's room. When he gets t the door, Carla exits. She smiles at him as she walks pas Confused, he double-checks the sign on the door, then ent

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Young Clubber stops, shocked, when he sees the carnag She's killed all four of them. Blood is everywhere. Behind the Clubber is a sign: "If This Restroom Needs Attention, Please Contact a Club Employee."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla walks through the crowd, and out the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carruthers locks the motel room door and closes the drape Josie sits on the bed. She starts to take off her blouse.

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: That's all right, honey. Not tonight.

dialogues.speaker: JOSIE
dialogues.text: What are you talkin' about?

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: I want you to curl up in that bed. Watch t.v. Go to sleep.  82.

dialogues.speaker: JOSIE
dialogues.text: And what are you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: I'm gonna sit in this chair. And I'm gonna watch over you. He pulls out his gun, a .357 magnum, and sets it on the t

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And if anybody comes after you, if anybody tries to hurt you, I'm gonna kill ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: JOSIE
dialogues.text: What about the money?

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: I'll give you the money. When it's all over. We'll get you out of this town. Josie's emotions almost break free. She curls up under th covers, she puts her head on the pillow. She looks at him

dialogues.speaker: JOSIE
dialogues.text: You anybody's daddy?

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: I was once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla enters. Marcus is sitting in a chair, under a lamp.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Where the hell have you been?

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What do you have in your bag?

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: It's a present. For you. Marcus rises, quickly. He grabs her purse and finds the small paper bag.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's none of your business! He snatches it away from her. She lets him open it: insid is a small silver case with a syringe, several needles, t small glass bottles.  83.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: You go from feeding the homeless to shooting heroin?

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: It's not heroin.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Let me see your arms.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Don't touch me.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Let me see your arms! He wrestles her. She fights. He pulls her to the ground. He pulls up her sleeves. She doesn't have track marks.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Satisfied?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I want Emma back.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: I'm not going to live my life as a saint. Not again. I tried that. It wasn't a happy ending. Marcus rises.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whatever's out there, I'm gonna try it. Everything. I'm gonna do it.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: (goes to the door) This is not what I wanted.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Leave it. He looks down at the silver case. He thinks it over, then tosses it to her. She catches it. He goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla sits on the edge of the bed. She holds the silver case, but doesn't open it. She sits, and thinks. She takes off her toy wedding ring, and holds it in the palm of her hand.  84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus walks along a city bridge. He takes his ring off. He throws it into the river. He stands, looking down at t water. He sees someone on the banks, watching him. It loo like Emma. It is Emma. He's certain of it. He starts toward her.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Emma. He gets to the bank, but she's gone. He looks around. She has vanished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla drops the toy ring into the trash. She rises and ge her coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus waits at an apartment doorway.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Open up. The door opens. Jenny, in her robe, looks out at him.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You want to hear a crazy story?

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: At two in the morning? You bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus sit at the dinner table. Jenny gets two beers from the fridge.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: You didn't see her, Jen. The look in her eyes. It's not Carla in there.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: You think it's this dead girl. Emma. That she's in Carla's body.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: No. I mean, I did. But...it's not Emma. I don't know who it is.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: I think you should get some help.  85.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Why did she go to that building? Of all the crackhouses in this city, why did she go to that one? And the way she...It's like she knew the place.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Okay, this is getting too freaky.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I'm not crazy.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: I know you're not.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: God, Jen. I don't know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: I think we should go see Martineau. Marcus sighs.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe he can help.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna see Martineau. Not tonight. She looks at him. There's something very maternal, very tender in her expression.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (he's so tired) I don't want to go home, Jen.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: I don't want you to go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny lies in bed. She looks through the doorway, into th bathroom. Marcus washes his face. She watches him. He finishes. He stops in her doorway.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: G'night. He smiles, and goes. She stares at the empty doorframe. She sighs, softly. Then turns out the light.  86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny wakes. Marcus, of course, isn't in bed with her. Sh gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus knocks on the door of a small craftsman style home A dog starts to bark. Martineau, the bearded eccentric we last saw in the library, opens the door cautiously. He we an unbuttoned sweater over a t-shirt. The dog, a Rottweiler, tries to get out.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU
dialogues.text: Get back! Klaus! Back! Sit! The dog obeys. Martineau turns his attention back to Marc

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Martineau. Hey.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU
dialogues.text: Haven't seen you in a while.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: This is going to sound kind of weird, but...I'm having what I think is a supernatural experience.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU
dialogues.text: Go talk to your priest.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I don't have a priest. Look, I could really use your help.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU
dialogues.text: Are you wired?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What? No.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU
dialogues.text: (opens door) Alright. Come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martineau closes the door after Marcus enters. The house a warm cave full of books and newspapers.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU
dialogues.text: Turn around. Hands on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Give me a break.  87.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU
dialogues.text: Do it, goddammit. Marcus complies. Martineau frisks him. The Rottweiler growls. Two more dogs, equally unfriendly, enter.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is this some joke? Some prank? You looking for a good laugh at my expense?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: No. I promise

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU
dialogues.text: You're clean.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: You've got lots of dogs.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU
dialogues.text: Seven of 'em. An important number, metaphysically speaking. The Egyptians believed that dogs have an instinctive god-like goodness. The doberman sniffs Marcus's balls.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: In fact, of all creatures, they're the most immune to any sort of domination or possession by demonic spirits.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: No shit?

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU
dialogues.text: Not one speck of it. So...at the station. They all still think I'm nuts?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU
dialogues.text: Wonder why. Martineau laughs. Marcus nods and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny is dressed in her uniform. She takes a last swig of coffee, grabs her keys from a hook on the wall and starts for the door.  88. When she opens the door, Carla is standing in the hall, staring straight at her. Jenny gasps and steps back.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: You spent the night with my husband.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Carla, listen--

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: You slept with my husband. I think I at least deserve a cup of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla waits at the kitchen table. Jenny puts a cup of cof in front of Carla, then sits at the table. The telephone attached to the wall behind her. Carla tries the coffee.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: If you fuck as bad as you make coffee, I don't have anything to worry about.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: I didn't have sex with your husband. Nothing happened. He wanted to talk. Carla is unconvinced.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You want to come to the bedroom and smell the sheets?

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: (a moment, then...) Do you mind if I use your telephone?

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Go for it. Carla gets up and takes the phone from the hook. She give Jenny a "give me some privacy" look. Jen looks down at her coffee and is lifting the cup when Carla wraps the phone's cord around Jenny's neck. She pul it tight. Jenny drops the coffee cup. It smashes. Jenny struggles to get free. Carla pulls the cord tighter Jenny's face begins to turn blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carruthers awakes in the chair. He immediately looks at t bed. Josie isn't in it. He stands.

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: Josie?  89. He looks in the bathroom. She isn't there. He checks his wallet. The money is gone.

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No. And he's out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus is seated at a small kitchen table. There are book and dirty dishes everywhere. Martineau drops a manuscript on the table in front of Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU
dialogues.text: You should take this manuscript. It's twenty-five bucks, but that just covers the cost of the photo copies. I want to get it published, but the only outfit that'll take it only publishes stuff about UFOs and Bigfoot and crazy shit like that. Marcus looks down at the coffee-stained manuscript: of the Afterlife" by Jacob Martineau.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: So, the um...the afterlife--

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Is it, you know, scary?

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU
dialogues.text: Well, that depends. Generally speaking, if you're not a bad person then your afterlife will probably be like a really nice weekend in Santa Barbara.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU
dialogues.text: But if you're an asshole, well, it'll probably be like your average Thursday in New Jersey.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: And do you have to go? I mean, let's Say you were a bad person, a really bad person, and you knew what was waiting. Could you, I don't know-- "Secrets  90.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU
dialogues.text: Stay here? Sure. Some do. Like poltergeists. Spend the rest of eternity moving furniture around, shit like that.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What about coming back, but...in another person's body?

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU
dialogues.text: Permanent possession.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU
dialogues.text: (rising) Let's go talk someplace else.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU
dialogues.text: Because this place is BUGGED! Martineau slaps the table and laughs. He starts out. Marc follows, with the manuscript.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie walks along the early morning street. There is very little traffic, very few pedestrians. She sees the Greyhound Bus station across the street, at next corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carruthers drives. He's looking for Josie. He doesn't see her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie starts across the street, toward the bus station. W watch her from inside a parked car. The car starts to mov forward. She walks. The car approaches and picks up speed. It is Carla's car. Carruthers sees Josie. The approaching car immediately picks up speed. Carruther sees the car. Josie doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: Josie! No!  gl. Josie sees the car, but it is too late. She freezes in th center of the road and stares at the demonic face of the driver. The car slams into her. Josie's body smashes into the car's windshield. The force of the hit sends her up and over the car, spinning throug the air, directly at an oncoming van. Josie's body crashes through the van's windshield. The PASSENGERS recoil, in horror. The driver slams on the bra A sign on the side of the van reads: MT. OLIVE BAPTIST YO CAMP. The car speeds past Carruthers. He looks at the driver, b sees only the demon. As she passes, the demon locks eyes with him. Inside the van, a YOUNG WOMAN looks down. A hand is on he breast. CAMERA PULLS BACK to show that it is Josie's seve arm. A YOUNG MAN looks down at his lap. Josie's severed head is face-down in his lap. He turns it over and looks into her bloody face. Everyone in the van screams. Carruthers watches as the killer's car turns the corner a races away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus and Martineau walk in a beautiful park. 100 year o oak trees line the path on both sides.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU
dialogues.text: Possession is most often accomplished by very ancient spirits, spirits who have never been worthy of receiving a human birth of their own.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Could someone who isn't one of these ancient spirits, someone who was alive, recently, return in someone else's body?

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU
dialogues.text: Not likely. The possessing spirit wouldn't have the skill or the strength to overcome the host. Not for more than a few seconds.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: But what if the host dies, then the host spirit leaves the body.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU
dialogues.text: Right.  92.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: And then somebody, like an EMT, brings the body back...

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: ..-But then another spirit, a different spirit--

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU
dialogues.text: --Enters the vacated body. Martineau stops walking. Marcus stops, also.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Right. Could that happen?

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU
dialogues.text: It's possible, but...to have that kind of skill, we're talkin'...this would have to be one extremely talented and very ancient spirit.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: But if it did happen, a good spirit wouldn't do this. She'd just...stay in Santa Barbara.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: So if it did happen, and this other spirit did come back...

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU
dialogues.text: Then you've probably got one very strong, very evil bitch on your hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla gets out of her car. The front grill is broken, and the windshield is smashed. She opens the trunk. Jenny, bound and gagged, looks up at her. Jen is terrifie Carla smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carruthers enters the ambulance station. He goes immediat to the front desk.

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: I need to speak with Marcus Galan. Right now.  93.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: I told you, sir-- Carruthers reaches across the desk and picks up her phone He pushes it into her face.

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: Call him. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus and Martineau sit near the front window of a coffe shop. They both have coffee.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: So how do I get rid of her?

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU
dialogues.text: Figure out why she's here. Maybe if you help her do whatever it is she came back to do, she'll move on. Marcus's cell phone rings. He turns it off.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What if she didn't come back to do something? What if she just doesn't want to move on?

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU
dialogues.text: She's stronger than you. You're gonna have to make her want to leave.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU
dialogues.text: She's evil. So be really really good.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What, should I start going to Sunday School or something?

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU
dialogues.text: Wouldn't hurt.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Should I wear a crucifix?

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU
dialogues.text: She's not a vampire, man.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Well, I don't know this stuff.  94.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no answer on the telephone.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mr. Carruthers. He slams the phone down, and starts out.

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: (shouting back at her) Keep trying him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus sits at a tall table in Martineau's basement works The place is an eclectic mix of religious iconography. We see books, diagrams, and paraphernalia from Kabbala, earl Cristianity, etc. Martineau approaches. He holds a nickel-plated .38 revolv He is loading it with bullets.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU
dialogues.text: Alright. We've got silver bullets. I soaked them, for 30 seconds, in holy water. Try one bullet to the heart. Another to the brain. He gives the gun to Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: You're out of your mind.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU
dialogues.text: We're not talking about murder here. The girl whose body it is--

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: My wife.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU
dialogues.text: She's long gone. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: You think this will...finish it?

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU
dialogues.text: I have absolutely no idea. We're venturing into new territory here. But, if I were you, I'd shoot her, put a stake through her heart, cut her head off, stuff her mouth with garlic and bury her a hundred feet deep. Might as well cover all the bases.  95. Marcus looks at the gun.

dialogues.speaker: MARTINEAU, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: In the probable words of George Armstrong Custer: "If you're gonna go down, go down fighting."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carruthers knocks on Marcus's door. He waits. Carla opens She is wearing simple clothes and an apron.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: I'm John Carruthers. Is Marcus in?

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: I'm afraid not. I'm his wife.

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: Good to meet you, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: He should be home anytime. You're welcome to wait inside, if you'd like.

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla tends to a large pot of soup on the stove. Carruthe sits at the table. A nice dinner is in the works. Wine, candles, flowers, yo name it. Two places have been set. A salad has been place at each setting.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: So you think this woman, this prostitute, came back. Possessed the other woman's body.

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: It's more like she stole it. Like the owner stepped away, but left the keys in the car. She hopped in and went on a little joyride.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: (tests the stew) I'm trying something new. I can't quite seem to get it right. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (back to Carruthers) And now the second woman's dead. So she's in somebody else's body.

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: I know it sounds insane. But, you see...my grandparents. They practiced the Old Time Religion, if you know what I'm saying. I was around it a lot as a kid. Scared the hell out of me...But I remember my grandma used to talk about these "hoppers." That's what she called them. Spirits that don't move on. As soon as one body's used up, they jump into another.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: So you think this prostitute was a...a hopper?

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: But it didn't start there. She and this school teacher were just the latest in what could be a thousand different lives. Carruthers pulls a photocopy of the medieval drawing from his pocket. He unfolds it.

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have you ever heard of Lilith?

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Lilith who?

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: It's an old legend. Adam's first wife, before Eve. Things didn't work out. Adam rejected her. So then God made Eve, and Eve became the mother of all living. But Lilith was angry.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Well, that's understandable.

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: And at death she refused to leave. She swore she'd get revenge on Adam and Eve and all their children. They say she's responsible for stillborn births, and the death of infants. And that she's the queen of these...  97.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Hoppers.

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: Right. Here's a picture. Carla looks over his shoulder at the winged female demon attacking the mother and baby.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: It's not a very flattering picture.

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: No. She holds the spoon out to him.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Here. You taste it. He tries it.

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: It's...it's good.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: There's something missing. She looks at his face, as if the answer is somewhere in h expression. She gently bites her lower lip.

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, ma'am. I don't have much of a head for cooking.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Hmmmm. She looks down at the picture of Lilith again.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh. I must look a mess.

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: Not at all.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: You're just being sweet. I'm going to go freshen up a bit. I want to talk to you more about this theory of yours. Don't go anywhere. She goes. Carruthers looks at the picture, then folds it and puts it back in his pocket.  98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus walks through the cemetery. A truck stops near him

dialogues.speaker: CARETAKER
dialogues.text: We lock the gate at dark.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Thanks. Marcus approaches Emma's grave. As he gets closer he sees someone at the grave. It is a woman. She wears a white coat. As Marcus gets closer, she turns. It is Emma. She smiles at him. He stops, several feet away.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Thank you, for being kind to my mother. He doesn't know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can't stay long. I was sent to tell you one thing. One thing only.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: You didn't come back to me. She smiles sadly, tenderly. She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: The good souls, Marcus...they don't come back. Where I am now, it's so beautiful. Marcus steps toward her.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Please...What do I...How--?

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: You're a savior, Marcus. A healer. We're alike in that way. We recognize that in one another. He takes another step toward her.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can't beat her. You can't hide from her. She's too powerful...Show her the strength of your goodness. The only thing she respects is strength. You must gain her respect. Marcus takes another step.  99.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Be true to yourself, Marcus, and death will be your victory. If you come where I am...she can't follow you there. He is almost close enough to touch her. She turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Emma. No, don't. She looks back. There is an odd expression on her face, a if someone is telling her something. Something alarming.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: You have to go home. Now. Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carruthers stands. He looks up at the kitchen clock. He sighs. He peeks out into the living room. He exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carruthers stands at the picture window. He looks at the sky.

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: No moon. He goes to the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Carla? Ma'am? He starts down the hall. He looks in the hallway bathroom She's not there. He looks into a small storage room. She's not there. He gets to the bedroom door. It is open a few inches.

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ma'am? Excuse me. The things I said...You must think I'm absolutely insane. There is no answer. He pushes the door open. She isn't there. The bathroom door is open. A light is on in the bathroom. He goes to the bathroom door. He looks in.

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ma'am, I'm sorry. I really need to speak with your-- She isn't there. He stands in the doorway, confused. He turns to go. She is not lurking behind him, as we expect.  100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carruthers enters the living room. He stands near the kit door. He hears a car approach outside. He crosses to the window. As he moves we see, in the background and slightl out of focus, that one of the World War I swords is missi He looks out the window. Marcus's car pulls into the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: CARRUTHERS
dialogues.text: Thank God. As he turns, we see Carla behind him. She screams and run at him. Startled, he freezes for a split second, just lon enough for Carla to bury the sword, to the hilt, in his b She steps back, leaving the sword in his body. He falls to his knees. She goes to the wall and removes t other sword. He slowly, painfully, pulls out his gun. Car stops in front of him. As he raises his gun, she swings t second sword. In one smooth motion, she removes his head. His gun drops to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus sits in his car. He looks down at Martineau's gun. He looks at the house. He sighs, gets out of the car, and tucks the gun into the back of his pants. He walks, slowl to the front door and turns the knob. It's locked. He takes out his keys and unlocks the door. When he final gets the door open, Carla is standing right there. Her expression turns immediately friendly.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: You're home.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Why was the door locked?

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Just...feeling a little vulnerable, I guess. Marcus doesn't enter.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have a surprise for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus follows Carla into the house. Carruthers' body is gone. The swords are back on the wall. Carla closes and locks the front door.  101.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Whose car is out there? She shrugs. He doesn't believe her.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: You look at me and you still see Carla. Baby, you don't have to worry about that stuff with me...I've made you dinner. Come on. She goes into the kitchen. He follows. As he exits we lin on the swords. Blood drips from the blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus enters the kitchen and sees the spread on the tabl The main course is still cooking in a big pot on the stov

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: What do you think? Marcus doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's my way of saying "I'm sorry." I've been acting kinda strange, I know. But some pretty weird things have happened to me. Everything's going to be alright. Sit down. I've got something for you. And she exits. But he doesn't sit. He wanders to the stov Some of the cooking dishes are half-covered with water in the sink. Some knives are on the counter. The big pot is covered, and still cooking. Some of the broth has boiled over the side of the pot. Marcus opens his cell phone and hits a speed dial. A reco message immediately answers:

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is Shawn. I'm ignoring you. Leave a message. Marcus lifts the lid on the soup. The big pot is almost full. It looks like stew. He sniffs it. Something's a lit off.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hey, it's Marcus. Where are you? He grabs the ladle and sticks it into the soup. It hits something. He pushes the ladle down deep and then pulls i up.  102.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into phone) I could use you here at the house, man. I need somebody to talk to. I think I'm losing my-- Carruther's head emerges from the soup.

dialogues.speaker: SHIT
dialogues.text: Marcus drops the ladle and the phone. He staggers back. Something catches his eye in the kitchen window: outside, Jenny is gagged and tied to a chair beside the pool. Marcus hears something behind him. WE RACK FOCUS from Jen to the reflection in the window: Carla is running toward him, the syringe held over her head. She brings it down. He spins. He grabs her arm, but the force of her swing al puts the needle into his chest. He twists her wrist. She drops the syringe, then immediately smashes her forehead into his face. He staggers back toward the sink. She grabs him by the throat.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: You can't beat me. Don't even try. He goes for the gun in his belt. As he's raising it, she knocks it from his hand. It flies across the room, over t dinner table. She goes for her knife. He knocks it to the other side of the room. He then knees her, hard, in the gut. She weaken but she doesn't let go. He spins her around and pins her against the sink. He forces her face into the dishwater. He holds her head under water. She fights. Her arms search for some weapon. She almost gets a knife. Her right arm knocks the pot fro the stove. The stew spills on the floor and Carruthers’ head rolls to the corner of the room. She slams her heel into Marcus's groin. He weakens for a moment. She gets her face out of the water. She gasps. He squeezes her throat as hard as he can. He lifts her feet from the floor. She snarls at him, but he doesn't let go. Instead he smas the back of her head into the kitchen window. The glass shatters. At the pool, Jenny struggles. She tries to scream, but sh has been very thoroughly gagged and tied.  103. Marcus tries to push Carla's neck into the jagged glass. She pushes him away. He slips on the floor and falls agai the wall.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I already had my throat cut once this week. Let's not do that again. She picks up a chopping knife from the counter.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your turn. She jumps on him. He manages to grasp her forearm, but sh thrashes wildly. It's like fighting a wild animal. He finally gets her turned over. He puts his knees on her arms. She struggles, but can't get free. She goes still for a moment. He looks at her face.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What are you?

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Do you really want to know what I am? She reveals the face of the demon. Marcus jumps back. He slips on the floor and tries to put as much distance betw him and her as he can. She crouches, then rises, and slowly reveals herself. She 100% demon. Her hands are claws. Her body has the color and texture of someone who has been dead for several days Marcus looks for anything to fight with. He starts openin drawers. He finds towels, spoons, measuring cups, nothing that's going to help him.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I've lived more lives than you could ever imagine. I've been everywhere on this earth. I've done everything there is to do. I've been men, women, and children in every place and in every time. He sees the syringe. He grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There's nothing you can tell me. There's nothing you can teach me. There's nothing you can think that would suprise me. She lifts the knife and goes for him. He thrusts the syri She shifts and misses the thrust. She laughs.  104. She lifts his arm and, very smoothly, slices his pectoral muscle at the armpit. He screams. He drops the syringe. She straddles him. She picks up the syringe.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're no more than a bug to me. You're a plaything. A toy. She sinks the syringe into his side. He shouts. She injec the fluid into him. He struggles. She lets him wriggle away. He rises and bac away. He stumbles into the dinner table. It all crashes t the floor. Carla advances.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can't run away from me. You could die, and I'd follow you into hell. She kneels beside him. We see from his point of view. His vision is beginning to blur. She straddles him again.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The human family. What a pathetic failure. Billions and billions of you, crawling across the planet, consuming your Mother Earth. And there's not one of you that wouldn't sacrifice a brother or a sister to save your own skin. Not even you, Marcus. You've saved a lot of people. But would you willingly give your life to save another? I don't think so. Marcus gets his legs under her and he thrusts. She flies back into the sliding plate-glass door. Her body crashes through and falls in a heap on the patio. Marcus rises on his elbows. She laughs. She stands and brushes glass from her clothes.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You like to play games, don't you, Marcus? Let's play...Justice. We can both win. I get what I want. And you get what you deserve. She picks up a shard of glass. It has been broken into th shape of a jagged edged knife. She starts toward Jenny. Marcus tries to stand, but he loses his balance and he fa He looks around for something that can help him.  105. He sees, in the corner, his nickel-plated gun. He crawls for it. Carla approaches Jenny. Jenny is freaking out.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm going to give both of you exactly what you've earned...Death. You never deserved life in the first place. Marcus grabs the gun. He crawls back toward the sliding glass door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla stands behind Jenny. She puts the jagged edge of th glass to Jenny's throat. She looks back at the house. Mar is gone.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Get back here and watch this, you coward! Marcus staggers into the doorway. He falls. He leans agai the jagged glass. He raises the gun. We see from his poin of view. Everything is so blurry. He tries to focus. He tries to aim, but can't. Carla puts her head near Jenny's

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Be careful where you point that thing. Marcus can't focus worth a damn.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll make it easy for you. Carla puts a hand on Jenny's chest and pushes her, chair all, into the pool. Jenny immediately sinks.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: There. Now it's just me. Marcus pulls the trigger. He misses.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One down. Five to go. Jenny struggles. She and the chair settle at the bottom o the pool. Carla starts walking toward Marcus. He, too, takes a step forward. He shoots.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not even close. She keeps walking. He fires again.  106.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: God damn. You ever shot a gun before? He walks toward her. He pulls the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mis-fire. That sucks. He shoots. The bullet tears a piece out of her shoulder. Now she's pissed, and she's only a few yards away.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One. Last. Chance. He fires. She stops. So does he. Did he get her? Jenny thrashes at the bottom of the pool. Carla stands her ground. Dizzy, Marcus drops to his knees in the grass. Carla unexpectedly drops to her knees, too. Marcus pops open the cylinder of the gun. He empties the expended cartridges onto the grass. Carla tries to summon the demon, but she doesn't have the energy. Her face almost gets there, then returns to norma Marcus picks up the mis-fired bullet from the grass. He puts it back in the cylinder and clicks the cylinder back into place. Carla looks down at her chest. She touches a hole over her left breast.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Right...in the heart. She's fading fast. Marcus raises the gun and levels it th inches from her forehead.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good...game. And he pulls the trigger. This time the gun fires, and bl Carla's brains out the back of her head. She drops. Marcus immediately discards the gun and crawls to the poo We see from his point of view. Everything is blurred and dizzy. Underwater, Jenny weakens. Her body convulses. She is breathing water now. Marcus crawls to the edge of the poo

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Jenny... He half falls, half throws himself into the water. He see her at the bottom. He uses all his strength to swim to he  107. She is conscious, but her lungs are filling with water. He tries to untie her. There's no way. He tries to lift her. He can't. He struggles. He fights. He watches as her eyes roll back. He screams in the water. He refuses to give up. He gets one of her arms free, then the other. He takes in water. He continues to untie her. He's fading fast. He gets one of her legs almost free when he loses consciousness. His hands slowly float away from the knot. His body drifts up toward the surface, his arms floating straight out at his sides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shawn kicks in the front door. Jackson is with him. Jacks sees Carruthers' body and goes to it. Shawn runs to the kitchen. Jackson sees that Carruthers' head is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shawn steps into the back yard. He sees Carla's body, the Marcus floating, face-down, in the pool, his arms straigh out at his sides. He drops his kit and runs. He dives int the water. He pulls Marcus to the edge. Jackson is there.

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: Take him. Jackson pulls Marcus to the concrete as Shawn goes back underwater. Jackson rolls Marcus onto his back. He pulls his arms over his head.
