Marcus immediately convulses and begins to vomit water. Shawn unties Jenny's leg. He takes her to the surface. Jackson is waiting at the edge of the pool. They pull her to the side and start working on her. Marcus slowly regains consciousness. He coughs. He vomits He breathes. He rolls onto his side and watches as Shawn and Jackson work on Jenny. Shawn is doing CPR. Jenny is unresponsive.

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Jenny) C'mon, girl. I'm not giving up. You hear me. We'll be here all night. I'm not giving up on you. He pumps her chest. Jackson breathes.

dialogues.speaker: JACKSON
dialogues.text: There's nothing, man.

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: Come on.  108. Marcus watches. His vision focuses enough to see what the doing. His hope turns to horror.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: No... Shawn and Jackson work.

dialogues.speaker: JACKSON
dialogues.text: She's gone, man.

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN
dialogues.text: Jenny, come on...come on, baby... He pushes on her chest. Her body unexpectedly convulses. She vomits water and coughs. Marcus's vision blurs and fades. As Marcus loses consciousness we....... FADE TO BLACK:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus awakes in a hospital bed. He is alone. He looks around. He sees some flowers and a couple of "Get Well" cards on the window sill. He looks out the door. Across the hall, in the opposite room, he sees another patient. She's sitting up in bed, eating a meal. It is Jenny. She sees him. She smiles gently. A NURSE enters his room.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Oh, look who's awake. You've got some color back in your face. The nurse pulls the curtain beside the bed, blocking Marc view of Jenny.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let's check your blood pressure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, the police detective, gets out of his car. He approaches the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank stands at Marcus's bedside.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Nothing more to tell?  109.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: It's just like you said. We were having an affair. She found out. She tried to kill us both.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Hell hath no fury like a woman scorned.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I guess that's true. Frank puts a business card on the table.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: John was a good friend of mine. It's hard to believe a hundred pound woman could take him down.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: She was no ordinary woman.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You and I both know that a lot more went down than what they're writing in the case file...Once you're healed up, you and I are going to have a sit down. I'll buy you a beer, and you're gonna elaborate on that story. Frank starts out.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You want the door closed?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: No. Leave it open. Frank goes. Marcus looks into the room across the hall. Jenny is gone. An ORDERLY is making the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nurse pushes Marcus's wheelchair beyond the front doors the hospital. He holds a plastic bag with his cards and toiletries. He's dressed in his street clothes.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: There you go. You sure you don't want me to call a taxi or somebody?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I'll be fine. Thanks. She turns and goes. Marcus takes a deep breath. He puts the plastic bag in a trash can. He looks around. A woman waits for him.  110. She stands several yards away and leans against a pillar. It is Jenny. She wears a long dark coat and looks absolut ravishing. She approaches.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: You pulled through. She smiles at him. He doesn't return the smile.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shall we walk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus and Jenny walk down a busy street. They are surrou by people, cars, noise, confusion, organized chaos. They don't talk. They stop at a busy corner. She turns to him. She gently bites her lower lip.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: I guess this is where we say goodbye. Thanks. It was fun. Marcus looks at her. He doesn't speak.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know, you can never kill me. Not really.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: You...took everything from me.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Not everything. She gets closer. She gives the lapel of his jacket a smal affectionate tug.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe we'll play again some time. And then she turns to go. She is several steps away when Marcus speaks.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Hey... She stops and turns to him. He has a hard time finding th words.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why do you keep coming back? Why do you...like it here so much? She smiles. She looks around at the people, the buildings the traffic, the life.  111.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: What's not to like? And then she turns and walks away. Marcus watches her go, until she is lost in the crowd. Jenny walks through the crowd, smiling. A small dog growl at her, then barks. The dog's owner, an OLDER WOMAN, trie to calm the dog. Jenny walks toward us. When she's so clo that her face almost fills the screen, her face reveals t demon. She looks directly at us, and screams.
